Posts.Content: kiwicaroline wrote: I was originally diagnosed in 1999 aged 32 with a 12mm grade 2 tumor no node involvement but signs of vascular invasion. I had a partial mastectomy, 6 weeks radiation, 6 months chemo and then 5 years tamoxifen. I really thought That i had done everything possible and that the cancer after all this time was behind me. I was gutted when they found a growth during ultrasound and that it was malignent. I had a mastectomy and imediate reconstuction 2 weeks ago. The histology results have come back showing there were 5 tumors 17mm, 13mm, 12mm , 11mm and a tiny 5mm. They were spread through out the breast. I'm gutted. I did everything possible and not only did the cancer come back but it came back bigger and better than before. Now we get to start the whole treatmentthingall over again. I was fine with the idea of one tumor but the idea that 5 had been growing away happily really freaks me out. Seeing the onc on friday to see what they want to do.Not looking forward to it at all. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: local recuurence 7 years after initial diagnosis kiwicaroline WendyInCalif
